title: 109_hr5939
content: The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" may be cited as the short title for this Act. This Act includes provisions related to terrorist offenses resulting in death. The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" includes a new offense related to terrorist offenses resulting in death, with specific definitions and penalties outlined in the amendment to Chapter 113B of title 18, United States Code. The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" adds a new offense related to terrorist acts resulting in death under Chapter 113B of title 18, United States Code. This includes specific definitions and penalties for offenses listed in the amendment. The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" introduces a new offense for terrorist acts resulting in death under Chapter 113B of title 18, United States Code, with specific definitions and penalties. The "Criminal Terrorism Improvements Act of 2006" introduces amendments to various sections of title 18, United States Code, to include death penalty provisions for offenses related to nuclear weapons, missile systems, atomic weapons, radiological dispersal devices, and the variola virus. SEC. 4. INCREASE IN PENALTIES: Amends various sections of title 18, United States Code to increase penalties for certain offenses. SEC. 5. MODERNIZATION OF STATE OF MIND REQUIREMENT: Updates the state of mind requirement for certain offenses. SEC. 6. PROVIDING MATERIAL SUPPORT TO TERRORIST GROUPS. SEC. 5. MODERNIZATION OF STATE OF MIND REQUIREMENT FOR SECTION 2339C OFFENSES. Amends Section 2339C of title 18, United States Code by changing the requirement from "unlawfully and wilfully" to "knowingly". SEC. 6. PROVIDING MATERIAL SUPPORT TO TERRORIST GROUPS. Amends penalties for providing material support to terrorists and receiving military-type training from a foreign terrorist organization. SEC. 7 amends Chapter 113B of title 18, United States Code to deny Federal benefits to individuals convicted of Federal terrorism crimes. It defines 'Federal benefit' and specifies the ineligibility for benefits upon conviction. SEC. 8 amends Section 2516(q) of title 18, United States Code by updating wiretap predicates. SEC. 9 modifies Section 2339D by including attempts and conspiracies related to military training offenses.
